intro: Lachnostachys cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-leaved lachnostachys, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
